alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 05 at 2:40PM MDT until May 06 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Recent warm temperatures have contributed to continued high river flows due to snowmelt. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Near minor flooding is forecast. Increased flow greater than the forecast will result in minor flooding. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet (4590 cfs), flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Friday the stage was 25.5 feet (4041 cfs). - Forecast...Flows will oscillate diurnally, peaking during the late morning to the afternoon. Current peak forecast is 26.5ft (4416 cfs) during the evening of Friday, May 12. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet (4590 cfs). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 300 PM MDT.
